de.spricom.dessert.slicing

Interface Slice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModuleSlice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDelegateSlice, AbstractModule, AbstractRootSlice, AbstractSlice, Classpath, Clazz, ConcreteSlice, DelegateModule, FixedModule, JavaModules.Management, JavaModules.Sql, JavaModules.Xml, JdkModules.InternalVmCompiler, JdkModules.Management, JdkModules.Unsupported, JpmsModule, PackageSlice, PartitionSlice, Root

    public interface Slice
    A Slice is an arbitrary Set of Clazz. A Slice is immutable in behaviour. It may use deferred evaluation or caching, but each method (incl. toString()) must produce the same result in any circumstance. Two different Slice instances are never equal, even if they represent the same set of classes.

      • minus

        Slice minus(Iterable<? extends Slice> slices)
        Creates a new slice that resembles the difference of this slice and the slices passed. Hence, the new slice contains all classes of this slice that belongs to none of slices.
        Parameters:
        slices - the slices to create the difference from
        Returns:
        the difference

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the difference

      • minus

        Slice minus(String pattern)
        This is a convenience method for this.minus(this.slice(pattern)).
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern for the slice to subtract from this slice
        Returns:
        a new slice without classes matching pattern

      • minus

        Slice minus(Predicate<Clazz> predicate)
        This is a convenience method for this.minus(this.slice(predicate)).
        Parameters:
        predicate - the pattern for the slice to subtract from this slice
        Returns:
        a new slice without classes fulfilling predicate

      • slice

        Slice slice(Iterable<? extends Slice> slices)
        Creates a new slice that resembles the intersection of this slice and union of the slices passed. Hence, the new slice contains all classes of this slice that belongs to any of slices.
        Parameters:
        slices - the slices to create the intersection from
        Returns:
        the difference

        Creates a new slice that resembles the intersection of this slice and the slices passed.
        Parameters:
        slices - the slices to create the intersection from
        Returns:
        the difference

        Returns:
        the slice

        Returns:
        the slice
        See Also:
        for predefined predicates

      • dependencyClosure

        Slice dependencyClosure(Slice within)
        Calculates the transitive closure of this slice's classes and their dependencies intersected with the within slice.
        Parameters:
        within - the slice within which the transitive closure is calculated
        Returns:
        the transitive closure of this slice and it's dependencies

      • contains

        boolean contains(Clazz clazz)
        Check whether a class belongs to a slice.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Clazz
        Returns:
        true if the clazz belongs to this slice

      • getClazzes

        Set<Clazz> getClazzes()
        Returns all classes belonging to this slice. This is only possible for slices based on the Classpath. A slice derived from some pattern or Predicate will throw a ResolveException instead.
        Returns:
        a set of all classes belonging to this slice
        Throws:
        ResolveException - if the classes cannot be determined

      • getDependencies

        ConcreteSlice getDependencies()
        Returns a slice of all the dependencies of this slices. That is the union of all of the dependencies of each class that belongs to this slice.
        Returns:
        the dependencies

      • uses

        boolean uses(Slice other)
        Check whether there is a dependency to some other slice.
        Parameters:
        other - the other slice
        Returns:
        true if this != other and there is one class in this slice that has a dependency contained in other

      • partitionByPackage

        SortedMap<String,PackageSlice> partitionByPackage()
        Partitions the slice by package.
        Returns:
        a map of the packages by package name.

      • partitionBy

        SortedMap<String,PartitionSlice> partitionBy(SlicePartitioner partitioner)
        Partitions the slice by some SlicePartitioner that maps classes to names. Clazzes the partitioner does not map to a name will be omitted form the result.
        Parameters:
        partitioner - the SlicePartitioner to partition by
        Returns:
        a map of slices by partition name
        See Also:
        for predefined partitioners

      • partitionBy

        <S extends PartitionSlice> SortedMap<String,S> partitionBy(SlicePartitioner partitioner,
                                                           PartitionSliceFactory<S> partitionSliceFactory)
        Same as partitionBy(SlicePartitioner), but creates specialized subclasses of PartitionSlice using a PartitionSliceFactory.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of slices returned
        Parameters:
        partitioner - the SlicePartitioner to partition by
        partitionSliceFactory - the factory to create the slices
        Returns:
        a map of specialized slices by partition name

      • named

        Slice named(String name)
        Creates a new Slice from this slice for which the Object.toString() returns name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this slice
        Returns:
        a new slice with that name
